cards.back: The Cartesian Product of two sets A and B is the set of all ordered pairs (a, b) where a is in A and b is in B. Use case: Cartesian products are used in database queries to combine rows from two or more tables.
A mathematical operation that takes two matrices and produces another matrix. Use case: Matrix multiplication is used in computer graphics transformations and neural network calculations.

An algebraic operation that takes two equal-length sequences of numbers and returns a single number. Use case: Dot products are used in vector mathematics, machine learning algorithms, and computer graphics.
The straight-line distance between two points in Euclidean space. Use case: Euclidean distance is used in clustering algorithms and similarity measures in machine learning.

In linear algebra, eigenvalues are scalars associated with a linear system of equations, and eigenvectors are the corresponding vectors. Use case: Eigenvalues and eigenvectors are used in principal component analysis (PCA) and other dimensionality reduction techniques.

A mathematical transform that decomposes functions into their constituent frequencies. Use case: Fourier transforms are used in signal processing, image analysis, and solving partial differential equations.
A vector that points in the direction of the greatest rate of increase of a function. Use case: Gradients are used in optimization algorithms such as gradient descent.

The logarithm of a number is the exponent to which another fixed number, the base, must be raised to produce that number. Use case: Logarithms are used in complexity analysis of algorithms and in scaling data.

A function that describes the likelihood of obtaining the possible values that a random variable can take. Use case: Probability distributions are used in statistics, machine learning, and risk assessment.

A method of statistical inference in which Bayes' theorem is used to update the probability for a hypothesis as more evidence or information becomes available. Use case: Bayesian inference is used in machine learning, decision making, and risk assessment.
A measure of the amount of variation or dispersion in a set of values. Use case: Standard deviation is used in statistics to understand the spread of data points.
A linear approach to modeling the relationship between a dependent variable and one or more independent variables. Use case: Linear regression is used in predictive modeling and data analysis.
A fundamental relation in Euclidean geometry among the three sides of a right triangle. Use case: The Pythagorean theorem is used in geometry, physics, and computer graphics.
The branch of mathematics dealing with combinations, permutations, and counting. Use case: Combinatorics is used in algorithm design, probability theory, and cryptography.
The study of graphs, which are mathematical structures used to model pairwise relations between objects. Use case: Graph theory is used in network analysis, computer science, and logistics.
A natural number greater than 1 that has no positive divisors other than 1 and itself. Use case: Prime numbers are used in cryptography, number theory, and computer algorithms.
The largest positive integer that divides each of the integers without leaving a remainder. Use case: GCD is used in simplifying fractions, cryptography, and algorithm design.
The smallest positive integer that is divisible by both of the integers. Use case: LCM is used in scheduling problems, cryptography, and algorithm design.
Numbers that have both a real part and an imaginary part. Use case: Complex numbers are used in signal processing, control theory, and fluid dynamics.
The branch of mathematical logic that studies sets, which are collections of objects. Use case: Set theory is foundational for many areas of mathematics, including logic, algebra, and topology.
